items.sentence: It is amazing; you should have won the prize.
Tom and Mary went trick-or-treating together.
Our broken water heater couldn't be repaired.
It was a nice party. You should've come, too.
We have to figure out what we should do next.
Whatever happens, get on that train tomorrow.
Books and documents are piling up on my desk.
Do you think it'll be raining again tomorrow?
My small donation won't make much difference.
Tom asked me to pass him the salt and pepper.
Tom gave a small nod of appreciation to Mary.
Tom got out of the car on the passenger side.
Tom has assisted us on a number of occasions.
Tom hasn't yet been informed of our decision.
Tom is heating up a burrito in the microwave.
Tom is probably the one who broke the window.
Tom is probably the one who scared Mary away.
Tom offered glasses of wine to John and Mary.
Be careful not to let the cat out of the bag.
Why is it so easy for Tom to learn languages?
